name: Elder Lyons
descriptions: Elder Owyn Lyons is the leader of the East Coast Brotherhood of Steel in 2277.

Lyons was born in the early years of the 23rd century, and was originally a Brotherhood of Steel paladin stationed at the Lost Hills bunker in South California. In 2251, his daughter Sarah was born. Sarah's mother died some time afterwards.

In 2254 the Brotherhood's ruling council decided to send a contingent of soldiers to the East Coast, with three important objectives. First, to scour the ruins of Washington, D.C., once the nation's capital, and recover any and all advanced technology. Second, to investigate the reports of super mutant activity in the area. Thus a small but hardened contingent of Brotherhood of Steel soldiers, led by Paladin Lyons (and accompanied by his three-year-old daughter Sarah, friend and technological adviser Scribe Rothchild, as well as Star Paladin Cross, Paladin Henry Casdin, Initiate Ishmael Ashur, Paladin Tristan, Knight Colvin and Paladin Gunny) set out from Lost Hills and began the long journey east to what was once Washington D.C.

Contact with the Midwestern Brotherhood turned out to be unsuccessful. On their way during their journey to the Capital Wasteland, the Brotherhood's expeditionary force came across the ruins of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. In a single night, the Brotherhood swept through the city from their staging area at Mount Wash, eliminating any resident who put up a fight. The intent of the Scourge remains unclear, but several unmutated children were taken from The Pitt by the Brotherhood and placed into initiate training, and many in the Brotherhood note that it was a marked change in the way the Brotherhood operates. Additionally, it is known that something was recovered from The Pitt during the Scourge, although to date it would seem that only Elder Lyons knows what it was.
Lyons' group finally arrived in the Capital Wasteland in 2255, establishing a base of operations within the Pentagon in the first few months.

Shortly after their arrival, Lyons' scouts have identified a new threat in the area: a peculiar breed of super mutants, infesting the deserted ruins of downtown D.C. Concerned by their presence and convinced that they are the primary threat to the wasteland, Lyons initiated a protracted campaign of aggression to exterminate them. Fighting the super mutants, simply keeping them at bay, may have been enough for the area's wastelanders, but for the Brotherhood, too many questions remained; foremost among them, the means by which these new mutants were being created, where they were being created and why they were using the people of the Capital Wasteland. Finding these answers would, ultimately, become Owyn Lyons' obsession.

The newly appointed elder decided that the super mutants were a threat not just to the Brotherhood and their scouts in D.C., but all the people in the wasteland. Thus, he began to direct resources towards fighting the mutants, gradually reducing the importance of fulfilling the primary mission objective, that is, recovering technology.

The years passed, but not in a way anyone had foreseen. Indeed, the Brotherhood of Steel's importance to the people of the Capital Wasteland was not something that Lyons ever expected. Nor was it something his superiors back in California cared at all about. Their newest elder had a clearly defined mission: to acquire advanced technologies in and around the ruins of Washington D.C. Finding the source of the super mutant threat and destroying it was important too, of course, but Lyons' prime objective was, first and foremost, the acquisition of technology. The super mutants were his second priority. Thus was the subject of every communication from the Brotherhood of Steel leadership in California.

However, Elder Owyn Lyons had another priority, one he considered more important than his original directive or any orders received since, which was the protection of the innocent people of the Capital Wasteland. And so, Lyons sent word to his superiors that he would continue his search for technology when he was damned good and ready, and would not sacrifice the people who had come to rely on the bravery and strength of the Brotherhood of Steel.

With the conflict straining his resources, Lyons attempted to persuade the West Coast, for several years, to send reinforcements and supplies, claiming to be following the mission objectives, but in secret, he continued to order his subordinates to save people by killing super mutants. However, no lie can be sustained indefinitely. Things came to a head when Lyons outright refused to follow a direct order from the elders. In response, the West Coast swiftly cut him loose, shutting off communications and denying any and all reinforcements. By 2277 there was no communication between the East Coast chapter and Brotherhood HQ for years.

The Californian corridors of Lost Hills erupted in rumor and speculation. Some claimed Owyn Lyons had "gone native," putting the needs of the people of D.C. above those of the Brotherhood itself; others saw him as a Brotherhood elder finally exhibiting the selfless behavior that should serve as a model for the entire order. Caught in the middle, the ruling elders made a decision: they would still recognize Elder Lyons as a leader of the Brotherhood of Steel and the Citadel as their D.C. headquarters, but all support from the West Coast was thereby cut off. If Lyons wanted to pursue his own agenda on the East Coast, he would have to do it alone.

Most of Elder Lyons' soldiers supported his dedication to the people of the Capital Wasteland and were proud of their leader's commitment to honor and heroism. The conflict with the super mutants dragged on for years, straining resources and manpower to the breaking point. Without the Brotherhood's support, the situation became progressively worse. However, Lyons' men continued to stick with him and follow his orders, primarily out of the doctrine of loyalty the Brotherhood taught them from birth.
Rallying behind Paladin Henry Casdin,

This was, without question, Owyn Lyons' darkest hour. He had become a man of compassion and understanding, and couldn't help but sympathize with those who had left; he had abandoned the Brotherhood’s primary mission. He recognized that and took full responsibility for it. Some of the knights and paladins who left had been his brothers for years. Together, they had shared victory and loss, pain and elation. But to those soldiers loyal to Elder Lyons, this dereliction of duty and theft of technology was an act of cowardice and treason. The dissenters would call themselves the "Outcasts," traitors to the Brotherhood of Steel; it was a name they would ultimately wear like a badge of honor, proud of the distance it put between themselves and Lyons' "soldier sycophants." One of these people who left was none other than Henry Casdin, who became the founder of the Outcasts.

The East Coast Brotherhood began 2277 as a diminished, weakened force, suffering from a shortage of qualified combat personnel and severely depleted stocks of weapons and equipment. As a result, the Brotherhood had a limited presence outside the Citadel, with only a handful of reinforced outposts scattered across the Washington metropolitan area, making Elder Lyons incredibly tired by his inability to act.

A year passed since many of his soldiers left to form the Brotherhood Outcasts, but Lyons was still dedicated to the cause of helping the people of the Capital Wasteland. He continued to send his troops into the D.C. ruins to help any who needed it, including the protection of Three Dog, a disk jockey who tries to get the message of the "good fight" to the people of the wasteland.

The Enclave attacked and occupied the Jefferson Memorial, where Project Purity called home. James, the leader of the project, sacrificed his life in an attempt to thwart Colonel Autumn's attempt to take over the project. While he failed to stop the Enclave, he managed to save the lives of the scientist Madison Li and his child, the Lone Wanderer. The two eventually made it to the Citadel, where Lyons allowed them safe haven.

After hearing of the resurgence of the Enclave, he immediately declared war on the Enclave and began a campaign to stop them. The Lone Wanderer required a Garden of Eden Creation Kit to get Project Purity functional and Lyons pointed them in the direction of Reginald Rothchild, after speaking to Rothchild, the Lone Wanderer headed to Vault 87 for the G.E.C.K.

Shortly before the Lone Wanderer's return, Owyn Lyons was debating with his daughter whether or not to launch an assault on the Jefferson Memorial and reclaim it from the Enclave. The Lone Wanderer returned to tell Lyons some ill news: that the Enclave had stolen the G.E.C.K. and would shortly activate the purifier. With this piece of information and his daughter's eagerness to attack, he ordered Lyons' Pride to assault the project and occupy it.
After the battle was won, the Brotherhood occupied the Jefferson Memorial and began to distribute clean, fresh water to the people of the Capital Wasteland.

Lyons once again enlisted the help of the Lone Wanderer to help defeat the Enclave, sending them to assist with the assault of the Satellite relay station and also tasked the Lone Wanderer with finding a Tesla coil in the ruins of Old Olney. After the Wanderer had completed these tasks they were sent to Adams Air Force Base to destroy the Enclave's last known major base of operations.

Sometime prior to August 2279, Owyn Lyons passed away, leaving behind leadership to his daughter Sarah Lyons, which was short lived as she perished in battle shortly thereafter. The East Coast Brotherhood subsequently floundered, led by successive ineffectual leaders.

Over the years, Maxson would proceed to carry out reforms which brought the chapter away from Lyons' beliefs and closer to Brotherhood orthodoxy, which in turn diminished Lyons' accomplishments in the eyes of the reunified chapter's members. By 2287, despite his accomplishments as the original leader of the East Coast Brotherhood, Owyn Lyons is remembered by soldiers of Maxson's Brotherhood as the "foolish" elder that led the Brotherhood astray from their true path of preserving technology.

However, Lyons' beliefs are not entirely lost. At least one member of Lyons' Brotherhood, an unnamed scribe, disagreed with its return to "ancient tradition" under Arthur Maxson and chose to leave the Brotherhood rather than compromise his values.
His daughter, Sarah Lyons, is a member of the Brotherhood with the unique rank of sentinel. Reginald Rothchild is an old friend of Elder Lyons.

As the leader of the Brotherhood of Steel, Lyons spends most of his day in the Citadel laboratory, A-ring or B-ring. He regularly converses with Scribe Rothchild, Bowditch, and Peabody on their various projects. In addition, he checks up on the progress on the Brotherhood's major project, rebuilding Liberty Prime, and supervises the armory as well as the smithy. When he is not working in the Citadel lab, he is usually eating in the A-ring's great hall, studying in his room in B-ring or sleeping.
Owyn Lyons appears in Fallout 3, its add-ons Broken Steel and Point Lookout,.

topics.topic_text: Has the Brotherhood ever faced a real challenge?
topics.response_text: A real challenge? Every blessed hour of every blessed day.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I think I understand.
topics.response_text: By all means. I'm always proud to talk of my Brotherhood.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me about the Outcasts?
topics.response_text: The Outcasts are a result of my greatest mistake. But a mistake I'm proud of, nonetheless.

topics.topic_text: I thought the protection of humanity was a part of the Brotherhood's oaths.
topics.response_text: Only in a very broad sense. The Brotherhood's oaths are to protect humanity's progress, but not necessarily every human.

topics.topic_text: How do your remaining soldiers feel about the Outcasts?
topics.response_text: Even now, a year after they left, the wounds of their departure are still sore.

topics.topic_text: Has your decision been worth it?
topics.response_text: Has it been worth the cost in lives and resources to protect people like you from the Super Mutants?{A little offended}

topics.topic_text: That's enough about the Outcasts.
topics.response_text: Yes, let's speak of other things.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about the Enclave?
topics.response_text: More than anyone else, I dare say. Certainly enough to know they're the greatest threat the Capital Wasteland has ever faced.

topics.topic_text: The Super Mutants are coming from Vault 87. It's their breeding ground.
topics.response_text: Vault 87? Where you found the G.E.C.K.? We've never been able to penetrate the radiation surrounding that area...

topics.topic_text: Anything you can tell me about the Super Mutants?
topics.response_text: Would you believe... "no"? It's pathetic, really, considering we've been fighting those abominations for nearly twenty years.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Certainly.

topics.topic_text: How long have you been here?
topics.response_text: It's been over twenty years since we arrived. And we've been struggling to contain and eradicate the Super Mutants for nearly as long.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know more about the Brotherhood of Steel.
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood is an old organization, going back to the years just after the war. We are but a part of it. What would you like to know?

topics.topic_text: Why are you here in the Capital Wasteland?
topics.response_text: Ah, now that's the real question, isn't it?

topics.topic_text: That's all I wanted to know.
topics.response_text: So be it.

topics.topic_text: If you're just a part of the Brotherhood, where's the rest of it?
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood began on the West Coast, and exists there still. We were dispatched to this location many years ago.

topics.topic_text: I'd like permission to trade.
topics.response_text: This is not normally something that we do. Trade with outsiders has proven to be... problematic in the past.

topics.topic_text: CitadelLyonsHolo1
topics.response_text: According to our latest reconnaissance report, Enclave soldiers have taken complete control of the Project Purity facility.

topics.topic_text: CitadelLyonsHolo2
topics.response_text: Here I sit, in the safety of the Citadel, while the people of the Wasteland thirst, and suffer, and die. Here I sit, a failed, feeble old man.

topics.topic_text: CitadelLyonsHolo3
topics.response_text: I cannot  I will not  allow the Enclave to control the one thing that could bring even the slightest spark of hope to these people.

topics.topic_text: What about the purifier? Did it work?
topics.response_text: Indeed it did. The Tidal Basin is full of fresh, clean water now.

topics.topic_text: Did we win? Did we beat the Enclave?
topics.response_text: Yes, we most certainly did.

topics.topic_text: How long was I out?
topics.response_text: Just about two weeks.

topics.topic_text: So what happens now?
topics.response_text: Well, that's really up to you, isn't it?

topics.topic_text: Wow. Well, thanks for taking care of me. I'm out of here.
topics.response_text: I wonder if you might be willing to aid us a bit further.

topics.topic_text: Where is Sarah? Is she okay?
topics.response_text: She's right here. Unresponsive, but stable.

topics.topic_text: Is there any way I can help?
topics.response_text: Indeed, we can use every able body available to us.

topics.topic_text: No thanks. I've had enough of this.
topics.response_text: That's a shame. We could use your assistance.

topics.topic_text: Where's Sarah? Is she okay?
topics.response_text: Yes, yes. She's fine. Or, she will be.

topics.topic_text: What's going on?
topics.response_text: It's all right, you're safe now. You're in the Citadel.

topics.topic_text: What happened? How did I get here?
topics.response_text: Please, relax. Everything is fine.

topics.topic_text: You couldn't have known this would happen. No one knew.
topics.response_text: And yet here we are.

topics.topic_text: Well, it's too late to turn back now.
topics.response_text: You're right, which is precisely my concern. We have pushed the Enclave, and now it seems they are pushing back, much harder than we expected.

topics.topic_text: Now's not really the time to be getting cold feet.
topics.response_text: No, it's far too late for that now. We committed ourselves to this course, and now we must see it through.

topics.topic_text: We have to keep fighting them. We can't back down now.
topics.response_text: Very true. And to that end, I'd like you to speak with Paladin Tristan.

topics.topic_text: Everyone here believes in you, and in the Brotherhood. We can do this.
topics.response_text: I sincerely hope you are right.

topics.topic_text: That doesn't sound like much of a leader talking.
topics.response_text: Please, do not presume to tell me my place, or how I should act. I am well aware of my responsibilities.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: What else can you tell me about the fight against the Enclave?
topics.response_text: As you know, I had my reservations about engaging the Enclave. They did not directly attack us, and I believed we had time. Time to be cautious.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything else I can do to help the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: Yes, yes indeed.

topics.topic_text: So, what happens to the Brotherhood now?
topics.response_text: Although we've all but eradicated the Enclave, many difficult paths still stretch out before us.

topics.topic_text: So, have we totally wiped out the Enclave?
topics.response_text: It would be naive of me to assume the Enclave threat is completely eradicated from our future.

topics.topic_text: What's going on with the purifier?
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood has taken over control of the purifier, and is managing distribution of the water to the people of the Wasteland.

topics.topic_text: DLC03TransitionTopic
topics.response_text: What do you mean, comatose? I'm sorry, but that's unacceptable. After all this, to be left in a state like that...

topics.topic_text: Can someone in the Citadel train me to wear Power Armor?
topics.response_text: Why yes. Yes, indeed, there is someone. Our intrepid Paladin Gunny trains all Initiates in the use of Power Armor. When they’re ready.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Please, I have much work to do. Talk to Sarah about your role in the assault.

topics.topic_text: Thank you. I'm not sure what to do now that he's gone.
topics.response_text: The most we can do is carry on his spirit. Live as he would have; make our world a better place.

topics.topic_text: I don't recall asking for sympathy.
topics.response_text: Really... I assumed that you would have taken after your father. I assumed incorrectly.{mildly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Thanks, I guess.
topics.response_text: Think nothing of it. Your father was a visionary. He spent his life trying to make this world a better place for all of us. Few can say that.

topics.topic_text: I don't have to explain anything. I don't answer to you.
topics.response_text: When we're done, I may just string you up from your precious purifier.

topics.topic_text: I don't have the G.E.C.K. anymore.
topics.response_text: Why not? Where is it?

topics.topic_text: The Enclave doesn't have the activation code. They can't start the purifier.
topics.response_text: Well, that gives us a little more time.

topics.topic_text: The Enclave is fractured. They're not as unified as they'd like us to believe.
topics.response_text: That's good news. Perhaps we can use it to our advantage.

topics.topic_text: The Enclave took the G.E.C.K. They're installing it now.
topics.response_text: Then we must go at once!

topics.topic_text: I escaped from Raven Rock.
topics.response_text: You are either very lucky, or very resourceful. You're the first I've heard to come out of there alive.

topics.topic_text: I was captured by the Enclave.
topics.response_text: You were? And yet you stand here before me. I find this hard to believe.

topics.topic_text: There's no time. We have to move now or we'll lose Project Purity.
topics.response_text: You think I am unaware? We've watched the build-up around the facility for the last week.

topics.topic_text: Well, sort of. I found the G.E.C.K.
topics.response_text: Excellent. With that, we hold the key to keeping the Enclave from controlling the purifier.

topics.topic_text: Well, it's not quite that simple...
topics.response_text: What do you mean? Explain yourself!

topics.topic_text: He wants me to add this virus to the purifier. I think you should take it.
topics.response_text: You've done the right thing. I'll turn this over to the Scribes for analysis.

topics.topic_text: Eden wanted me to sabotage the project with some kind of virus.
topics.response_text: I see. And where is this virus now?

topics.topic_text: The President let me go.
topics.response_text: Is that so? I find your story increasingly hard to swallow. Why would he do such a thing?

topics.topic_text: Raven Rock is destroyed.
topics.response_text: Is it now?

topics.topic_text: I don't have it anymore. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Just as well. No good could come from it.

topics.topic_text: I have it here. Take it.
topics.response_text: Thank you. I'll see to it that it's disposed of properly, once the Scribes have had time to analyze it.

topics.topic: TLRobotAre you in charge of the um... the robot?
topics.topic_text: So what's the deal with the robot?
topics.response_text: Ah yes. Everyone asks about the robot. Hard not to, I admit.{amused}

conversation.response_text: Brothers, as we take our meal this day, let us reflect upon the words of Elder Patrocolus of the Montana Bunker.
Brothers, today I offer a simple prayer.
Excellent. I'm a bit concerned, though. Last week, you mentioned a possible delay in the secondary modifications?
We have shortages all around, my friend. Make do the best you can. We may not have the Enclave's resources... but we do have you.
Certainly, Sarah. What's on your mind?
Oh, Sarah. My dear, sweet girl. So eager you are to rush headlong into battle. But no, not now. Not yet. Our time will come, fear not.
That name is not to be spoken within this Citadel. Do you understand? I wish it were not so, truly I do, but he is Outcast. He has been judged.
I understand, Peabody. But you'll need to make do the best you can. If our weapons can't penetrate that Enclave armor, we stand no chance.
About that. Are you still having that issue with the head laser? I think the term you used was "invariably destructive"...
Rothchild, old friend, you're a brilliant technician. But this old man's patience is wearing thin. I want a full status report in three hours.
Please be careful. I would hate to lose you again.
Very well. We'll sort this all out.
You don't have to like it, Sarah. You just have to follow orders.
Then it's decided. Sarah, you take the Pride and use the robot as support. Take our friend here and secure that purifier.
